intro: Ageratum isocarphoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers come in shades of purple, pink, and white, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
